_exec_summary.SummaryText:
ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE POLICIES



HyLife Foods - Windom, LLC is strongly committed to employee, public and environmental safety. This commitment is reflected in a comprehensive accidental release prevention program. This program addresses the design, installation, operation, maintenance, and employee training associated with the process equipment at the facility. 



HyLife Foods - Windom, LLC senior management is not only committed to offering superior service, but also to maintaining a safety and environmental program to promote a safe environment for all its employees and the surrounding communities. HyLife Foods - Windom, LLC's safety and environmental policies as they relate to the ammonia refrigeration system are administered by the Superintendent, who conducts inspections of the facility to ensure compliance.

 



STATIONARY SOURCE AND REGULATED SUBSTANCE



HyLife Foods - Windom, LLC is located at 2850 Highway 60 E in Windom, Minnesota. The facility is located on the outskirts of the main city near Cottonwood Lake. The area immediately surrounding the facility is rural with mostly agricultural areas. The City of Windom is located south-southwest of the facility. The facility began operations in February 2017.  



The primary business of HyLife Foods - Windom, LLC is to provide cooling, processing, and storage of pork food products. In order to conduct operations, the facility maintains a refrigeration system containing approximately 35,415 pounds of anhydrous ammonia, a regulated substance.  The refrigeration system, consisting of piping, valves, and equipment, cycles ammonia through various physical states (high pressure liquid, low pressure liquid, low pressure vapor, high pressure vapor, and then back to high pressure liquid) in order to provide refrigeration for cold storage, dock operations, and processing.  Typical operating conditions range from 11 inches of mercury vacuum on the low pressure side of the system to 175

psig on the high side.



ACCIDENTAL RELEASE PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICAL-SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS



The HyLife Foods - Windom, LLC ammonia refrigeration system has many safety features.  Much of the safety of the system is inherent in the policies and procedures that govern the operation of the system.  For example, the facility operates in accordance with OSHA's Process Safety Management regulation.  



The facility including the ammonia system was designed and constructed in accordance with the International Mechanical Code applicable at the time of construction, which specifically outlines requirements for the safe operation of the ammonia refrigeration system.  These safety features include ammonia sensors in the Machinery Room as well as sensors in the cold rooms and vent line. In addition, the majority of the ammonia is maintained inside the Machinery Room and just outside of the Machinery Room (condensers). All pressure vessels are equipped with pressure relief valves that relieve into a common header that vents to the atmosphere (except for the Air Handling Unit Surge Drums and Spray Chill Water Chiller Surge Drum which vent individually to atmosphere).



In addition to the International Mechanical Code, HyLife Foods - Windom, LLC has developed a preventive maintenance program that utilizes the services of a professional refrigeration contractor to complete regularly scheduled inspections and tests of the ammonia refrigeration system as well as repairs as needed to process equipment.



FIVE YEAR ACCIDENT HISTORY



The EPA's RMP Program defines "accident" as the following: 



"The release must be from a covered process and involve a regulated substance held above its threshold quantity in the process. 



The release must have caused at least one of the following: 



?     On-site deaths, injuries, or significant property damage (?68.42(a)); or 

?     Known offsite deaths, injuries, property damage, environmental damage, evacuations, or sheltering in p

lace (?68.42(a))." 



HyLife Foods - Windom, LLC became the owner of the facility and began operations in February 2017. Therefore, there have been no significant releases of ammonia that exceeded the Federal Reportable Quantity of 100 pounds or that meet the definition above.



EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM



The HyLife Foods - Windom, LLC facility has an emergency action plan in effect.  The Emergency Action Plan (Plan) is detailed in the Emergency Planning and Response section of this PSM/RMP document. This Plan was designed to meet the following objectives:



  1.)  To save lives.

  2.)  To minimize and avoid injuries.

  3.)  To protect the environment.

  4.)  To minimize property damage.



The facility maintains a safety committee whose members are the designated emergency coordinators for the facility.  The Plan provides the response organization and notification procedures, evacuation routes, ammonia health hazards, and mitigation procedures, which will be implemented to respond effectively to emergency situations that may arise at the facility. This Plan was reviewed and updated to ensure compliance with the PSM and RMP regulations.



In case of an ammonia emergency, the facility plans to evacuate all employees and contractors and put the facility's action plan into play to respond to the situation.  If necessary, they will alert the local emergency responders (fire department) for assistance. The facility plans to coordinate emergency response efforts with the fire department on a periodic and ongoing basis.



PLANNED CHANGES TO IMPROVE SAFETY



The Process Hazard Analysis Revalidation, conducted on December 1, 2021 , including a Hazard and Operability (HAZOP) study and a Facility Inspection, provided mitigation measures to improve safety at the HyLife Foods - Windom, LLC facility.  The HyLife Foods - Windom, LLC safety committee is planning to complete several items over the next year, as a continual effort to provide a safe work environment for th

eir employees.  These changes include the following items:



1. Continue to train all employees in the facility Safety Plan/Programs.



2. Continue to have employee involvement in Safety Plan Development.



3. Continue employee involvement through safety team participation.



4. Continue internal and external safety audits/inspections and implement changes as needed.



DATA ELEMENTS NOTES



Item numbers 7.8a, 7.8b, 7.10a, 7.10b, 7.11a, 7.11b, and 7.15 have been intentionally left blank.  These items (Management of Change, Compliance Audits, Incident Investigation, etc.) have been developed for HyLife Foods - Windom, LLC and will be implemented when required.  In addition, the Emergency Action Plan outlines notification procedures and reporting procedures in the event of an emergency, which could include fire, ammonia release, blackout, and earthquake.
